 First of all, a theory in science is not the conviction of a single person. That is your first oversight. The 2nd oversight is the tacit assumption that a theory is formulated by subjective interpretation. Let's start with the first assumption.
 
 The theory of evolution by natural selection is the result of the collective work of thousands of biologists & geologists over the course of a century & a half. The amount of data collected over this period is staggering, and no one scientist could ever absorb it all in a single lifetime. So if there is subjective bias on behalf of one expert, it is balanced out by the views of many thousands of others who view the same data. Also, every experiment or observation made by one individual must be duplicated by others.
 
 This brings us to the 2nd assumption. There is more to gathering evidence than interpreting data. The evidence must also have predictive value and be capable of explaining all known phenomena. This cuts down on the subjective bias, considerably. For example, it can be predicted that all living mammal species will have 3 middle ear bones in each ear, rather than one, since the fossil record clearly shows the exaptation of the bones of the reptilian jaw joint to form these ear bones. Finding these 3 bones in the ear of a bird or amphibian would greatly challenge the theory of common descent. This is a very objective check upon interpretation of data that is hard to fudge with bias.

 1) The granite samples with halos contain myrmekite - an indication that the samples were not from primordial rock.
 2) Halos are found in areas where Uranium is rich, but not where it is scarce.
 3) Halos line up along visible fractures in mica (a mineral found in granite).
 4) This points to another possibility: Rn-222 from U-238 decay migrated along cracks in mica then decayed into Po-218 / Po-214 / Po-210 respectively thereby giving the halos.
 
 However, this issue of the halos is a diversion, because creationists also have to dismiss untold thousands of radiometric dates from U-238, K-40 & Rb-87 decay which concur with eachother at least 95% of the time.
